title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Scale AI lays off 14% of staff, largely in data-labeling business
items.description: Scale AI is cutting 14% of the company just weeks after Meta invested $14.3 billion in the startup and hired away its CEO.

items.title: OpenAI and Anthropic researchers decry ‘reckless’ safety culture at Elon Musk’s xAI
items.description: The criticisms follow weeks of scandals at xAI that have overshadowed the company's technological advances.

items.title: DHS Faces New Pressure Over DNA Taken From Immigrant Children
items.description: The US government has added the DNA of approximately 133,000 migrant children and teens to a criminal database, which critics say could mean police tr...

items.title: ElliQ Review: An AI Companion Bot for Lonely Elders
items.description: The AI-powered ElliQ robot and smart display aim to improve life for older folks living alone.

items.title: India eyes global quantum computer push — and QpiAI is its chosen vehicle
items.description: QpiAI, an Indian startup that integrates AI and quantum computing for enterprise use cases, has raised $32 million in a new funding round co-led by th...

items.title: Can US Measles Outbreaks Be Stopped?
items.description: The US almost lost its measles elimination status once. Lessons from that episode suggest it will be more difficult to avoid doing so now.

items.title: Dyneema’s New Fiber Composite Is Lighter, Stronger, and More Durable Than Ever
items.description: Hyperlite Mountain Gear and Dyneema collaborate on lighter, more durable hiking backpacks, which lets you put even more Dyneema on your Dyneema.

items.title: GMC Hummer EV outsold the Tesla Cybertruck last quarter
items.description: As Elon Musk once said, "We dug our own grave with Cybertruck."

items.title: Watch Our Livestream Replay: Inside the AI Copyright Battles
items.description: Curious about generative AI and copyright? On July 16, our writers answered your questions about this critical topic.

items.title: GM teams up with Redwood Materials to power data centers with EV batteries
items.description: GM will send batteries — new and old — to Redwood Materials, which will assemble them into large packs capable of supporting data centers and the grid...
